node.title: Is Australia facing an exodus of international students that could undercut its global position?
node.alt: A woman in a floral shirt looking sad in a backyard.
node.description: Australia's international education sector is facing a critical time as it tries to recover from COVID border closures and keep its footing in the global market.
node.content:
["Zarana Patel never thought her decision to study in Australia could turn into a seven-year struggle.", "The 26-year-old came to Australia from India as an international student in 2014 and graduated with a bachelor's degree in accounting three years ago.", "Ms Patel said, although she was satisfied with the education, she has been struggling to find a professional job due to her visa status and\u00a0lack of\u00a0work experience.", "\"International students\u00a0are making efforts,\u00a0we have gained knowledge and skills [from university] and still you are being rejected just based on you are not a permanent resident or citizen here,\" she told The Business.", "\"Whatever I have to do to fulfil\u00a0all the requirements, I have done that, but as the government is making strict rules regarding permanent residency here, I don't see any hope.\"", "Ms Patel said she didn't feel appreciated in Australia, so she decided to pack up and move to Canada for her further study and a better future.", "A survey by IDP Connect shows a growing number of international students are choosing Canada, the UK and the US over Australia to study.", "", "Australia's global share of demand has dropped from 17 per cent to 12 per cent over the past two years.", "In the Indian market, the\u00a0demand has plummeted from 20 per cent to 9 per cent during the same period.", "Among 3,650 respondents from 55 countries, 39 per cent of the students chose\u00a0Canada as the top destination,\u00a0followed by the USA and UK (both on 17 per cent) and Australia on 16 per cent.", "The study also found\u00a0migration incentive,\u00a0employment\u00a0opportunities and\u00a0on-campus study were strong\u00a0drivers in students' decision making.", "
Students looking for opportunities elsewhere
", "Like Ms Patel, many international students came to Australia not only for the quality of its education system, but also for potential migration pathways.", "", "
Zarana Patel says she regreted\u00a0coming to Australia to study.(ABC News: John Gunn)
", "As the COVID-19 pandemic saw the country shut\u00a0its borders, nearly 150,000 international students have\u00a0been stuck overseas.", "Many onshore students felt the pinch as they missed out on government subsidies while also\u00a0losing their jobs, and being\u00a0unable to return home.", "While she was studying, Ms Patel had to work\u00a0across different jobs in Western Sydney\u00a0to make a living while paying for tuition fees and the high costs of\u00a0applying for\u00a0permanent residency, including English exams that cost her a total of\u00a0$8,000.", "\"The education system is really good in both Australia and Canada. But the thing is, after study the opportunities are really fewer, I would say, in Australia than Canada.\"", "She said many of her cohort have changed their minds and are heading to countries with open borders, face-to-face classes\u00a0and less restrictive immigration policies.", "This year, international student numbers have dropped by 17 per cent, according to the latest data from the Department of Education.", "
Uncertainty\u00a0over Australia's global position
", "It's a worrying trend for education agent Vaibhav Patel.", "", "
Vaibhav Patel says international students are shifting to countries with welcoming student visa policies and migration policies.(ABC News: John Gunn)
", "He runs an education agency in Sydney, recruiting international students, especially from South Asia.", "His business relies on international students, and it has dropped 80 per cent in overseas recruitment since COVID struck.", "\"I believe that there was a time, before pandemic, when Australia was one of the top countries for sourcing international students, now that choice is changing,\" he told the ABC.", "The peak body for the tertiary education sector, Universities Australia, believes that Australia hasn't lost its appeal, but argues it must act quickly in the coming months to maintain its market position.", "\"I think it would\u00a0be a mistake to say, in any sense, there's been an exodus from Australia, because international students have stuck really well,\" CEO Catriona Jackson told the ABC.", "", "
Catriona Jackson says the sector is \"tough and resilient\".(ABC News: Matt Roberts)
", "\"Other countries have responded very intelligently, they've loosened up some of their work rights criteria, their borders have been open.", "\"If we don't keep up, if we don't get students back at scale by first semester next year, it is really hard for us to maintain our position.\"", "
The first batch to return\u00a0after a long wait
", "Mr Patel said it's understandable why some students chose to leave or changed course.", "\"It's super frustrating, because you can't really give your client\u00a0clear advice on what's going to happen because the policies keep changing according to the outbreaks in the country,\" he said.", "\"It was really hard for us to convince our clients that we are doing something for you, but then there's nothing much that is in our control.\"", "There have been calls for a travel ban exemption for international students to re-enter over\u00a0the past year. Some have given up hopes of returning, others have graduated without ever setting foot on campus.", "That will change soon.", "New South Wales and Victoria have promised to bring back international students through\u00a0pilot programs from next month.", "Up to 250 students will be allowed to arrive each fortnight in NSW, starting from December 6, and 120 students each week in Victoria from later that\u00a0month.", "Both states will not require international students to quarantine if they are fully vaccinated with a TGA-recognised vaccine.", "A spokesperson from the South Australian government told the ABC that\u00a0the state would\u00a0welcome international students back once it reached its\u00a090 per cent fully vaccinated\u00a0target.", "\"We continue to work with the federal government to find ways for international students to return to South Australia as quickly and safely as possible,\" the spokesperson said.", "
Regional universities hit the hardest
", "Revenue from international education has been an important part of tertiary education system for more than\u00a0three decades.", "", "
The lack of international students affects the\u00a0broader economy.(ABC News: Lucas Hill)
", "For some universities, two-thirds of their revenue is generated from international students.", "Universities Australia said the sector was set to announce a $2 billion\u00a0loss in revenue this year, higher than last year's figure of $1.8 billion.", "While some metropolitan universities have been stable in their international enrolments, regional universities have been hit the hardest.", "\"In 2019, international fee income from international students was in the order of $170 million;\u00a0we expect this year to barely make $80 million,\" University of Wollongong deputy vice-chancellor Alex Frino told the ABC.", "\"Our story is very similar to most other regional universities who have probably lost about 40 to 50 per cent of their international students.\"", "", "
Alex Frino says international students are vital to Australian universities and the local economy.\u00a0(ABC News: John Gunn)
", "In stark contrast, international student enrolments at Group of Eight (Go8) institutions, including the University of Queensland and the University of Western Australia, only fell by around 1 per cent.", "Mr Frino said\u00a0tuition fee discounts and brand familiarity are the contributing factors.", "\"We always do really well by recruiting face-to-face and having people in the field recruiting and the Go8 don't need to do that, or haven't done that historically,\" he said.", "\"The fact that our recruitment teams haven't been able to access offshore markets during the pandemic has been a significant factor\u00a0and, again, that's quite similar to other regional universities.\"", "
A glimmer of hope for 2022
", "As Australia's international borders start reopening, universities and education agents say\u00a0they are optimistic for the 2022 academic year, and\u00a0eager to get back into the field recruiting again.", "\"[International students] create global connectivity for our [local] students that's vital to their future careers, and they also add a lot to the local economy.\"", "With a high vaccination rate and currently controlled COVID situation, some students\u00a0have been able to enjoy a sense of normalcy on campus for a while.", "", "
Charle Darwin University student Po Yan Wong says she's lucky to study in Australia.(ABC News:\u00a0Michael Donnelly)
", "\"I have all the classes face to face, and of course I\u00a0can choose to go online,\" Hong Kong international student Po Yan Wang, who arrived in the Northern Territory late last year through the first charted flight, told the ABC.", "\"I enjoy networking and also I\u00a0get the chance to participate in the events that are organised by the university.", "That does provide a glimmer of hope for many students to come.", "Watch the story on The Business\u00a0at 8:45pm AEDT on ABC News\u00a0Channel, or stream on ABC iview."]
